content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
Please supply me copies of all communication including postal & email between council officers and from council officers to third parties and received from third parties such as maintenance companies or divisions within the council such as the rates office that mention, include or refer to myself, “Mrs Julie Fretwell, my business within Crystal Peaks market, “Julies Snaxx” or my current and past market stalls 13,14,15,16,17
Yours faithfully,
Julie Bamford

Dear Julie Bamford,
Subject Access Request – SAR ID 914174
We write in reference to your request for access to the information we
hold about you. The request that you sent to the Freedom of Information
team has been passed to the Subject Access team because you are asking for
personal data that cannot be released under the Freedom of Information
Act.
Under Data Protection law, you have the right to request access to the
personal data we hold about you.  This is called a Subject Access
Request.
Before we can accept a Subject Access Request, we need to ask you for the
following:
• Identification.  You will need to provide two forms of identification,
one which includes your name and current address and one which
includes your name and date of birth.
Please note: If the information you have requested is needed by a
particular date, for example, for a court hearing, please provide also
proof of your court date and we will take this into consideration.
You can send your documents by email to [1][
email address
],
or you can take them to any of our First Point Offices.
You can also post them to Resources Business Support (Subject Access
Requests), Sheffield City Council, PO Box 1283, Sheffield, S1 1UJ.  We
recommend that you do not send original documents through the post and we
do accept photocopies.
Once identification documents have been received and we are satisfied we
have all the information we need, we will proceed with the request and are
required to provide you with a response within 1 month.  If we do need
further information from you, we will let you know.  Sometimes, for more
complex requests, we are entitled to extend the response time to a maximum
of 3 months.  We will let you know where this is the case.
Please note we are not required to comply with a request until the
identification documents have been received and will close a request if
these are not provided within 28 days from the date of this letter.
For information about the way we handle subject access requests, please
see our website at [2]www.sheffield.gov.uk/sar.  For information about
data protection in general and your rights, please see out website at
[3]www.sheffield.gov.uk/privacy, or you can look on The Information
Commissioner’s Office’s website at [4]www.ico.org.uk.
If you have any queries about this letter please let us know.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council
PO Box 1283
Sheffield, S1 1UJ
Email: [5][
email address
]
